page.title: 10I.C.I JEALOTT'S HILL
page.content: I.C.I. has a plant north of Bracknell (the largest of its kind) at Jealott's Hill that discovers and develops crop protection chemicals e.g. weedkillers and insecticides. Innovations are looked for to solve crop problems of the world, this led to the presentation of the Queen's Award for Export. 130 chemists are continually working on problem solving experiments. Conservation is of such importance that preservation of old hedgerows and bird surveys are essential work. The station brought 650 jobs to the area and numbers are growing. Workers come from a 20ml radius. It helps with the Y.T.S and employs a large % of females. Bus and car are the main transport systems. Workers are kept happy with the playing field and clubhouse.
